title: What will be the impact of the role of artificial intelligence in business? - Quora

response.answer_text: Artificial Intelligence is just crawling into our life and affecting how we work and do our business. Some of us are not even aware about how it can be effectively utilised, and some of us are assuming this technology to be a threat. However, this technology isn’t in the slightest bit as threatening as people think it is, although it is very new and it’s changing the world faster than any technology has managed to up to this point.  Artificial Intelligence has significantly helped us in growing our businesses. Here’s how: Smarter Email MarketingSome research shows that Email marketing has the highest return on Investment. So we all know how important email marketing is for a business. AI helps us to automate emails, these emails are sent on anniversaries, birthdays, whenever a customer creates account on our website, so on & so forth. Also it helps you in segmenting your customer list according to your needs. Effective Customer ServicesThe most effective way to engage your customers the most is by interacting with them directly. It is believed, people tend to understand what you do and what your business is about, when they get are told personally. Chat bots are the answer, which are enabled with the help of AI. Reduce Repetitive TasksYou can always eliminate the work load from your employees by freeing them from something that is need to be done regularly. AI helps you automate the process, and hence other employees can work on what is more important. Business ManagementFrom scheduling conferences and team meetings to programming business trips and decision-making support, AI can help with business management activities. One such example is DOMO, it is one of the fastest growing business management software company that helps company make decision faster. Finance and AccountingAccording to a research by Forbes, it is believed that in coming few years, most of the accounting work will be transferred to AI. It will be able to perform all accounting tasks. Currently, AI is helping to interrogate, assess and challenge the predictions that underpin the valuation of assets on their clients’ balance sheets.  Research suggests that AI doesn't always perform best on its own. AI technologies are great at driving or even replacing the lower-level, repetitive tasks, but businesses often achieve the greatest performance improvements when humans and machines work together.

How does AI help business? Let’s look at an example. HR processes despite having “human” in the name can also be transformed into an automated AI operation. One of the core tasks of an HR department is hiring new employees. Decisions of this caliber may seriously affect the business of a company of any size. To minimize the risks, artificial intelligence can analyze all of the potential candidates and present you with the most optimal choice.  It can be based on their skills, need for a certain specialist in your organization, and even biographical facts. AI eliminates any bias a recruiter may or may not have. So will AI replace all recruiters? Not in the near future. While it certainly makes their job easier, the machine cannot yet tell whether or not a person will be a good fit. The company culture and interpersonal relationships are also huge factors in the hiring process. While AI is able to scrape for “managerial experience” it can’t differentiate between a supportive and a tyrannical leader. The same principle works when applying AI to other business areas as well. One of the most substantial impacts is on the analysis of Big Data. Such huge amounts of data are impossible to process as accurately and effectively by hand. Often the work that can be done in minutes by AI may take months of human labor. As long as the information is objective, the results you receive have an extremely low margin of error. But that’s just descriptive analysis. Behavioral and historical patterns provide you with even more useful insights. That’s the most beneficial aspect of AI in business intelligence systems. More in article

1. Improving personalised shopping experiences Providing customers with personalised marketing increases engagement, helps generate customer loyalty and improves sales. This is why companies are putting so much effort into it. One of the advantages of using AI is that it is able to identify patterns in customers’ browsing habits and purchasing behaviour. Using the millions of transactions stored and analysed in the cloud, AI is able to provide highly accurate offers to individual customers. 2. Automating customer interactions Most customer interactions, such as emails, online chat, social media conversations and telephone calls, currently require human involvement. AI, however, is enabling companies to automate these communications. By analysing data collected from previous communications it is possible to program computers to respond accurately to customers and deal with their enquiries. What’s more, when AI is combined with machine learning, the more the AI platforms interact, the better they become. One example of this is AI Chatbots which, unlike humans, can interact with unlimited customers at the same time and can both respond and initiate communication – whether on a website or an app. It is estimated, that by 2020, 85 percent of all customer interactions will be taken care of by intelligent machines that are able to replicate human functions. The days of using a call centre look like they are coming to a close. 3. Real-time Assistance AI is also useful for businesses that need to constantly communicate with high volumes of customers throughout each day. For example, in the transport industry, bus, train and airlines companies, which can have millions of passengers a day, can use AI to interact, in real-time, to send personalised travel information, such as notice of delays. Some bus companies, for example, are already tracking the location of their buses and using AI to provide travellers with real-time updates about where the bus is along its route and its estimated time of arrival. Customers receive this information on the bus company’s app. 4. Data mining One of the biggest advantages of using cloud-based AI is that artificial intelligence apps are able to quickly discover important and relevant findings during the processing of big data. This can provide businesses with previously undiscovered insights that can help give it an advantage in the marketplace. 5.Operational automation AI is able to operate other technologies that increase automation in business. For example, AI can be used to control robots in factories or maintain ideal temperatures through intelligent heating. In Japan, human-looking robots now serve as receptionists in some of the countries’ hotels automating check-ins, booking services and dealing (in four languages) with customer enquiries. In retail, AI is also being linked with RFID and cloud technology to track inventory. In China, police forces use AI to catch criminals. The country has a vast CCTV network and AI uses facial recognition to spot and track suspects so that they can be apprehended. 6.Predicting outcomes Another advantage of AI is that it is able to predict outcomes based on data analysis. For example, it sees patterns in customer data that can show whether the products currently on sale are likely to sell and in what volumes. It will also predict when the demand will tail off. This can be very useful in helping a company purchase the correct stock and in the correct volumes. It is predicted that, within 10 years, the days of seasonal sales will be over as AI will mean there is too little leftover stock to sell off. This ability to predict is not just useful in retail. AI is also being used in many other areas, for example, in banking where it can predict currency and stock price fluctuations or in healthcare where, remarkably, it can predict outbreaks of infections by analysing social media posts. 7.Improve the recruitment process It may be bad news for recruitment companies, but AI is now helping businesses automate the recruitment of new employees. It is able to quickly sift through applications, automatically rejecting those which do not meet the company’s personal specification. This not only saves time (or money spent on a recruitment agency), but it also ensures that there is no discrimination or bias in the shortlisting process. The AI programs available can even take care of the many administrative tasks of recruitment. Conclusion As you can see, AI systems provide businesses with a wide range of benefits, including personalised marketing, customer service, operational automation, inventory management and recruitment. And these are just a few of the many ways AI can be used. What’s remarkable, however, is that many of the AI apps, which are designed specifically for cloud-based systems, are quickly and easily deployable. Companies whose systems are in the cloud can be benefitting from them in no time at all. Source: 7 Benefits of Artificial Intelligence for Business AI for Insurance Executives

AI is a scientific art of creating human-like intelligent machines. And is proactively being used in businesses everywhere. Apple is one big example. Any Apple product owner is very well versed with Siri, which is nothing but sheer AI. Siri is a voice interface that surfs through playlists, attend calls on your behalf, have entertaining conversations with you and much more. AI can be considered as a parent concept to many baby concepts, machine learning, robotics and many more. We will emphasize on artificial intelligence and machine learning in this post. 1. Can retarget customers with ads On E-Commerce Sites As a business owner, targeting the right set of audiences online is very important. Using machine learning, which is one of the most vital arenas of AI, proves to be of great advantage here. Machine Learning (ML) overtime learns user habit, behavior, preference and accordingly segments them for better targeting. For e-commerce sites, ML maps your audience, studies them and assists you with clever product re-targeting wherever your audience is on the worldwide web. For example, a potential customer searched for a mobile phone on your e-commerce website. He found a good handset on your site. He checked out the price, features and other specifications of that particular handset. ML studies this behavior and further retargets him by showcasing ads or other product promotions of the same handset on other websites he goes.  Also, machine learning can be used to target your customers at the right time so that they will buy. For this, ML finds out the time they are most active online and targets them at that time. 2. Chatbots can be used for Customer Service & Care Chat + Robot = Chatbot! The chatbot is a software that communicates with humans through text messages, answers their questions and even performs actions when asked to. Chatbots can be integrated with your website and mobile applications externally as they: Stay with you round the clock for prompt customer support.Empower your employees by assisting them.Promote quick customer call transfers. For example: When you call your service provider, most of the times you will hear a mechanical voice asking your perform certain actions like, press 1 for bill payments, press 2 to continue in English and so on.Chatbots are mainly used to stay in touch with your site users at every step. It is a great customer engagement and care tool of artificial intelligence in business! 3. Can Convert Visitors To Customers Using CRM AI is revolutionary when it comes to selling products to your customers! All that is needed for this revolution is your customers’ data stored in your customer relationship management (CRM) system. CRM is actually a technique that compiles customers’ information like their email, phone, & social media and their interaction with the company. When you integrate AI tool into your company’s CRM: It analyzes your customer’s dataSo, your sales team understand your customer betterIt predicts whether he/she will be lead or notFor example, the AI tool predicts that the customer is a lead by analyzing his personal details, interest, and activity. Now, you can turn this lead into a customer by targeting him with marketing strategies like promotional emails and various offers to increase their engagement. 4. Get Marketing Analytics with AI With artificial intelligence in businesses, you can market any of your products at a much lower budget. This is possible through AI tools that manage marketing campaigns. These tools analyze your ads’ performance on various parameters which includes reach, users, bounce rate and more. The tools also prove helpful as they suggest campaign budgets, keyword bids and so on. Similarly, you can also pull out vital marketing metrics, for example, email sent, clicks and open rates, the best time to post, etc.. This data then enables you to increase your customer database and provide the best services to them at the perfect time! 5. AI can Build Customer-Centric Products You should know whether your customers like what you are selling or not. If not, you are missing out on ways to make your product better. Using tools of artificial intelligence in business helps you with this! For example, AI tool like Keatex shows customer feedback with green and red tabs. The tool basically alarms you with customer feedback you received for your product or service. The red tab indicates negative feedback and the green tab refers to all the positive feedback. Now that you know your product negatives and positives from your customers’ point of view, you have the potential to change all the red tabs into the green ones quickly and easily using various efficient marketing strategies. Here are some of the ways Artificial Intelligence can be used in business. To read more interesting stuff like this:

When considering AI adoption, it is crucial to first identify the right use case for your business. A lot has been written about AI and it is considered a buzzword in tech industry. AI can do a lot varying from customer experience to reducing churn. The key in looking for the benefits of AI is not in what other people think about it – it’s about finding the value it can bring to your organization. My advice would be to reach out to more AI resources, get some inspiration and filter what is applicable to your company. Start with the following: 1.Predict future events and generate business insights Whatever question you need AI to answer, it can do it and it will keep getting better at answering. What movie will Jane like? Will customer X churn? Will this item sell out? AI can provide accurate predictions about future outcomes based on historical data. Artificial intelligence converts information into knowledge and even gives you insight into the future! Of course, AI is no fortune-telling technology but it can support your business with predictive analytics. Predictive analytics is a form of analysis with the use of machine learning – the algorithms analyze historical and current data to make predictions of future outcomes. With the use of relevant historical data AI can: reduces churn by identifying the clients who want to leave,increases sales by suggesting what the customer wants to buy and determines how much they will buy,identifies employees who are likely to leave the company,predicts demand for resources, product, and inventory,identifies the risk of breakdowns, failures, malfunctions, and errors.As an example, read this case study of one Polish telecom that used predictive analytics to reduce churn by over 20%. 2. Save time AI is automating routine process much like industrial era machines automated labor. It takes AI systems a short moment to make an informed decision – a human will need more time. It’s an obvious time-saver. Let’s have a look at the data from Deloitte’s How much time and money can AI save government? report. The figure below illustrates the most time-consuming tasks of government workforce and the automation potential of these activities.  3. Save money Coming back to the example of government workforce time savings, Deloitte estimates that even low levels of effort behind AI adoption could save government workforces between 2 and 4% of all their labor hours. With medium involvement, AI and machine learning could bring savings of 13 to 15% of time requirements within five to seven years. And with strong support for AI adoption, the potential benefits are 27 to 30% of time savings within five to seven years. Look at the table below to see the numbers:  What’s more, PwC Global estimates that by 2030, the potential contribution to the economy from AI will be 15.7 trillion dollars and the global GDP could be up to 14% higher as a result of AI. 4. Reduce error Artificial intelligence isn’t error-free. It can make mistakes but generally speaking, it’s much more accurate than humans. In many cases, the accuracy is around 99%, even for very sophisticated systems, such as Google’s LYNA (Lymph Node Assistant) that achieved the accuracy of 99% and 69% sensitivity in metastatic breast cancer detection, according to VentureBeat. Artificial intelligence is not as prone to errors as humans are – its great advantage is that it makes decisions based on the available data only. 5. Enhance customer experience In the times when the market is extremely competitive, AI-powered solutions help create great customer experience which helps increase customer loyalty and boost sales. A study conducted by Zendesk shows that 42% of B2C customers purchase more after a good customer service experience, while bad customer service interactions result in 52% of customers not buying. 59% of shoppers who experienced personalization think that it has a big influence on their purchase decisions. When Amazon introduced their recommendation system, they saw a 29% increase in sales. These numbers show that the “everyday” use of AI that customers are already accustomed to brings real value. Summary In reality, every use case brings different benefits. Artificial intelligence can improve customer service with the use of chatbots and recommendation systems, increase revenue by identifying and maximizing sales opportunities, predict product demand, classify customers, predict customer behavior, detect fraudulent credit card transactions, detect malware, review documents, do research, help diagnose patients… The list could go on. Find your business case to benefit from AI!

Life doesn’t stay still. AI-powered apps help o cope with a growing amount of data while providing data-based insights, that’s a way for businesses to become smarter. Thus in the musical industry, AI can be used to create theme and lyrics. The latter is created on the basis of analyzed conversations or newspaper headlines. In the financial sector, machine learning can be used for preventing losses by discovering fraud in transactions. AI helps in collecting data, analysis, and revealing illegal activities.  If people needed to analyze all the data manually, it would take them months. Thanks to AI, entrepreneurs do not need to focus on minor repeated functions anymore since the AI-powered apps will do it instead of them. Among AI advantages there is fact that it performs faster than people and excludes any probability of human-made mistakes. When speaking about AI there is no possible way to avoid the concept of machine learning. The last allows machines not just solve repetitive tasks, but also analyze, understand the already existing practices, find solutions or even plan future actions. AI influences customer-related processes as well. Customer service is proven to be more effective when being AI-enabled. Just as an example, in call center management machines are able to analyze customers tone or emotions due to deep learning analysis and (if necessary) redirect customers to human operators.  AI-powered Chatbots are absolutely faster and cheaper than customer service hotline. “Hello Hipmunk” is a nice example of AI-driven chatbots. It can be integrated with a travel application and allow users to instantly get the answers. Additionally, the chatbot analyzes people conversations, emails and calendars within the application and acts as a travel assistant. It books hotels and tickets, chooses a place for dinner or provides you a list of sights based on people’s preferences. There are much more benefits and solutions that AI can bring to businesses and I’m sure there will be a lot more in the nearest future.

In reality, artificial intelligence contains a group of technologies that offers sense and intelligence to machine and computer systems. For this reason, artificial intelligence and its sub-technologies offers a wide range of benefits to businesses of every type. Let’s see how: Personalized user experience through enhanced machine interactions. The current AI systems can gather data, analyzing patterns in data, and understand user behavior to offer the advanced experience to users.You can automate multiple sections of your business with the help of artificial intelligence. This automation can not only improve efficacy and reduce errors but also reduce the burden on employees. You can utilize these resource in more strategic job roles.AI-powered chatbots can now talk almost as equal as a human Representative. In the absence of a human professional such as in the right, chatbot can assist your users and enhance communication.Using the dataset acquired by your AI machine, you make better sales and business decisions. This data can tell you the correct status of your sales efforts, which can help you improve in the future.Artificial intelligence can be utilized in business in multiple ways. For instance, spam detection, fraud detection, spam filtering, RPA, etc. If you also wish to utilize these capabilities of AI, complete an AI certification form Global Tech Council.

There will be impact of artificial intelligence in all Business Bad or good impact is depend on the Business owner how they are taking it Yes it will effect on Human power but we have to loose something to get something The concept, however, leans to what experts consider "strong AI," which focuses on artificial intelligence systems that are capable of functioning as flexibly as the human brain. The AI is not expected to become a reality for at least three decades. What appears today in countless daily applications, instead, is what is known as weak AI Weak AI operates within a narrowly focused field of expertise, performing either one or a few basic tasks more effectively than humans can do. Few explain of Weak AI in Business Logistics systems that help businesses like UPS route their trucks to save time and fuel.Air-traffic control systems that determine flight plans and choose the optimal landing gates for airplanes.Loan-processing systems that assess the creditworthiness of mortgage applicants.Tools for voice recognition that manage incoming calls and provide automated customer service.Digital personal assistants, including Apple's Siri, who scan various data sources and offer answers in plain English.

Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think like humans and mimic their actions. The term may also be applied to any machine that exhibits traits associated with a human mind such as learning and problem-solving. Business advantages of Artificial Intelligence Numerous organizations take up computerized reasoning (AI) innovation to attempt to lessen operational costs, increment effectiveness, develop income, and improve client experience. For the greatest benefits, businesses should look at putting the full range of smart technologies - including machine learning, natural language processing, and more - into their processes and products. However, even businesses that are new to AI can reap major rewards.  Artificial Intelligence Impact On Business Industry By conveying the correct AI innovation, your business may increase the capacity to: set aside time and cash via computerizing and advancing routine procedures and undertakingsincrement profitability and operational efficienciessettle on quicker business choices dependent on yields from psychological advancementsstay away from mix-ups and 'human mistake', given that AI frameworks are set up appropriatelyuse understanding to anticipate client inclinations and offer them better, customized understandingmine huge measure of information to produce quality leads and develop your client baseincrement income by recognizing and amplifying deals openingsdevelop skill by empowering examination and offering wise guidance and backingAs indicated by an ongoing Infosys study, the primary main impetus for utilizing AI in business was a contender advantage. From that point onward, the motivation originated from: an executive-led decisiona particular business, operational or technical probleman internal experimentcustomer demandan unexpected solution to a probleman offshoot of another projectAdvantages of AI and people cooperating when humans and machines work together, businesses would often achieve the greatest performance improvements. AI technologies might be great at driving or even replacing the lower-level, repetitive tasks but research suggests that AI doesn't always perform best on its own. AI opportunities for business Whatever your reason for considering AI, the potential is there for it to change the way your business operates. All it takes to start is an open-minded attitude and a willingness to embrace new opportunities wherever and whenever possible. Keep in mind, however, that AI is an emerging technology. As such, it is changing at a fast pace and may present some unexpected challenges. These are some of the benefits and also the impact of Artificial Intelligence Services on Business Industry. Source: How Artificial Intelligence Works.Business benefits of artificial intelligence

AI is something that we all know about and look forward to seeing how far it goes. The variety and scale of applications of Artificial Intelligence not only helps in sectors and areas of our daily lives now but businesses too. Setting new trends, innovating new products and services, and helping everyone see how AI helps and enhances our lives beyond comprehension. But, when we talk of business, AI is an area that is currently finding out where it stands and where it can go. Getting rid of past notions, innovating new ways of dealing with business improvement to leading into the future, AI helps businesses flourish and how: Enhancing marketing performance: Marketing has been the front door and the dashboard on how to view your business performance. In other words, business intelligence and analytics with the help of the various applications of machine learning and AI is reaching new heights every day. Where business intelligence and data analytics has become the norm to assess your business performance, AI is the main driving force. Businesses are using AI to help personalize, target and improve the efficiency of their marketing efforts, and overall customer experience by fine-tuning their strategies. New methods, strategies as well as ways of enhancing how marketing teams work, AI has and is still helping overhaul the entire system dynamically.New methods of innovation: There is so much to explore in terms of AI applications in the business world, that there is not a single way or predefined way of seeing where things go. Businesses are using AI to reach new heights which haven’t been possible before. AI helps in innovating new products and services, enhancing and customizing customer experience, redefining ways to work on the business, enhance employee performance, and the way business is running. There are new opportunities for employees, and avenues to explore for career growth and ultimately helping companies flourish like never before.Enhancing customer experience: Because of the ever-rising competition and gruelling marketing challenges, businesses can leverage AI to improve their customer experience. Using AI in helping designing products and services, reassessing how they interact with business websites, and ultimately help them have a fulfilling experience, there is a lot to look forward to. AI is an area that is enhancing and impacting the way businesses and customers work together for a better two-way experience, and that’s all thanks to data and AI. From new site designs, the way we interact with businesses (chatbots, virtual assistants, among others), logistics, and the complete shopping experience is taking on an AI-driven approach.It is hard to predict where AI is going to take businesses and how customers interact and react to marketing techniques, but the entire world and AI are learning as they go. This is a perfect reason to be excited to see what is coming for us and businesses as AI pushes the limits of computing and innovation like never before.

What is recurring and boring actions at your workplace can be done by the AI system. That is the simplest way to answer the question. The transformation that shaping in the business world is un-imaginable. It's happening on a large scale. From planning, scheduling, organizing to deliver the product to customers, AI has hand in every area. In the automobile sector, AI-equipped software and systems are helping to design the model and test the vehicle. 3D printings are helping engineers to look at the vehicle model in real-time, and make effective decisions. In other manufacturing side, companies are employing AI to deliver customized products to needy customers on time. I recently viewed a video on twitter platform, where a customer is entering the retail showroom and complete his purchase within seconds, and leave the shop, without making payment in real-time. Here the payments are done through mobiles using a QR scanner. The AI can also be used in the coffee vending machine and other vending machines. Facial recognition and gender recognition are used in the machines to memorize the customer's previous choices. When they approach the machine again, the system looks for previous data and brew coffee for the customer, literally automatically. The below-given article will give an insight into these. https://thinkpalm.com/blogs/facial-recognition-ai-driven-smart-vending-machines-enhancing-retail-industry/

MD Anderson cancer center launched “moon shot” program which costs them too much almost about 62 million dollars and cognition based approach hold on because cost too much and the Cognitive technology as it copy the function that human brain performs in multiple ways such as to recognize patterns and to process language Different projects they launched but some companies want to bring dramatic changes through AI which is not possible but low honey fruits which are easy to develop are operate successfully AI implications in real world is CCTV cameras also in there development stages because although they capture things but not have detailed monitoring, Widely used in health care and many other fields as well There are different steps for AI that include 1st of all we need to know what AI is how it works what are the challenges associated with it And then have to recognize problematic area that we want to resolve through AI In addition to we have to conduct feasibility analysis to assess its worth as well as asses the gap where we are now and where we want to grow in near future by using AI Furthermore have to do pilot projects to assess its validity and also collect the required and essential data Humans are the most intelligent creature on earth and the purpose of AI to produce systems that work effectively, efficiently and without human support and perform actions similar to humans Powerful AI is the one that copy human mental potential

Role of Artificial intelligence is to automate routine tasks and make decisions the way a human would have done. In addition, AI can solve complex problems, make predictions about business parameters and help Enterprises becoming Digital. Aritificial intelligence adds the cognitive flavours to the range of automation activities. Be it mechanical bots carrying out the shopfloor chores; or a medical bot performing complex surgeries; or software bots the digital workers managing your enterprise's backend operations; powered with artificial intelligence support them to take decisions without human interventions and they keep learning from their past. Artificial Intelligence has entered in practically every field in the business in some form or the other. It will change tomorrow's workforce by leveraging very rapidly evolving AI and ML technologies into business operations. This is already leading to routine tasks being automated, complex decisions being taken by machines and even customer interactions being handled by Virtual Agents and Chabots.

Below are the things AI Can Already Do for Your Company Process automation. Of the 152 projects we studied, the most common type was the automation of digital and physical tasks—typically back-office administrative and financial activities—using robotic process automation technologies. Cognitive insight The second most common type of project in our study (38% of the total) used algorithms to detect patterns in vast volumes of data and interpret their meaning. Think of it as “analytics on steroids.” These machine-learning applications are being used to: predict what a particular customer is likely to buy;identify credit fraud in real-time and detect insurance claims fraud;analyze warranty data to identify safety or quality problems in automobiles and other manufactured products;Cognitive engagement. Projects that engage employees and customers using natural language processing chatbots, intelligent agents and machine learning were the least common type in our study (accounting for 16% of the total). This category includes: intelligent agents that offer 24/7 customer service addressing a broad and growing array of issues from password requests to technical support questions—all in the customer’s natural language;internal sites for answering employee questions on topics including IT, employee benefits, and HR policy;

Artificial Intelligence allows machines to sense, comprehend, act and learn. Whereas Machine Learning gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed. They both, together with Natural Language Processing (NLP) can transform any business and thus can help in solving many business problems. Lets see where you can use Artificial Intelligence, Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning in your business : 1. Detecting User Intent You can use Machine Learning together with NLP to identify the sentiment, language and topics from any given text. This can be useful in call centers or customer service department where you want to analyze customer interactions by using support tickets, emails, social media posts and phone transcription. 2. Classifying Images Correctly If you are manually classifying images then you know how time taking it is. But with AI and ML, you can classify large number of images appropriately in no time. Infact you can detect any inappropriate content without involving any human eye. It can be used to identify the objects, people, text, scenes or faces. So, if you want to try new generation of attendance system in your office then Machine Learning can detect, analyze, and compare faces for you. 3. Predicting Results No, Machine Learning is not a fortune teller but yet it can help you to predict the outcome of your activities. If you supply it past few years sales records then it can predict how much you are going to sell this year! The more the data, the better would be the prediction. It can also be used to predict the customer churn based on statistics and customer pattern. 4. Matching Candidates You can use AI and ML for matching the best resumes for your job requirements. With use of NLP and ML, you can easily classify the resumes based on experience, skills and regions. Infact you can automatically filter out all the in-appropriate resumes based on your rule sets and can select the best one that matches your requirements. 5. Analyzing Videos AI and Machine Learning can be used to analyze videos in your organization. You can do people counting, gender identification or even user tracking by analyzing videos in your office or store. Check the interesting Case Study where we did customer counting via webcam in retail stores in Australia. The analysis can be done on real-time videos or pre-stored videos in batches from a cloud storage. It can be used to automatically detect explicit or suggestive content in videos too. With the new set of frameworks and tools, gone are the days of costly and lengthy implementation of AI and ML applications. Now any experienced developer can design and deploy AI/ML application within two-three months time. And you need not to have big budget for such application as there are plenty of affordable API based options available for use. Amazon, IBM and Google are the leaders in this space but there are other small but very specific providers too like if you want to build chatbots then you can quickly use Wit.ai or Gupshup - Bot Builder Platform. Source: Where AI, ML And NLP Can Be Used In Your Business?

It may not. Since there is no information about your business, answering this is just a shot in the dark or a referral to something that might be generic enough to be a “one-size-fits-all” program. There are any number of AI type programs on the market today. There are any number of qualified programmers that can write a custom AI just for you (if you have enough money and time). There are any number of People like myself that would be happy to research the market for you if you want to provide more details about your question. Yes, AI helps businesses. I worked for a large company in the beginning of the internet as we see it today and during my time there we acquired a program that self-taught itself solutions to common questions from the field where the actual work of the company was active. It was a major help. Since then all sorts of AI enabled programs are running and they help business.

AI is everywhere. Your smartphone uses AI to understand voice commands. Siri, Google Assistant, and Microsoft’s Cortana all use AI to understand what you’re telling them to do. Below statistics make it evident that artificial intelligence is here to change the way businesses function- A survey done by PwC, it is predicted that artificial intelligence is going to drive the global gross domestic product (GDP) profits of a whopping $15.7 trillion by the year 2030.24% of the global companies have already opted for artificial intelligence to get an edge over the competition. After all, a blend of machine learning and language processing along with cognitive abilities to work is something that is way more ahead than human intelligence, thereby stimulating error-free and fast work.A survey done by Gartner says that by the end of 2020, 85% of customer interactions within a business will be done without human interactions.If this isn’t a reason enough to take this plunge, we have got covered a lot more benefits of artificial intelligence for you. Have a look: Impeccable customer serviceNatural Language GenerationFacilitates risk managementVirtual AssistantsOptimizes inventorySpeech recognitionWorks as a great management toolSuperior Enterprise Mobility through AIEnhanced client engagementIncreased Efficiency & Higher Precision at Lower CostsProvides high-end securityIntegrate and Consolidate Business OperationsFrom the above-mentioned benefits, it is quite clear that investing in artificial intelligence can prove to be a very smart strategic decision for your business. Coming-of-age technology, which is also referred to as artificial intelligence, has been sweeping across different spheres and triggering knowledgeable discussions regarding the fate of humanity. The current buzzword concerning AI is ‘robots are taking over.' Is there truth to this assertion? If the findings of McKinsey Global Institute Report are anything to go by, certainly, the answer is yes. According to the study, by 2030, a large number of current employees will be required to learn new skills because machines will handle their duties. This is one of the challenges associated with the adoption of artificial intelligence. However, like the two sides of a coin, this technology portends positive outcomes for businesses. The primary ones are: Enhancing personalized shopping experiencesReal-time customer supportStreamline the Hiring processMinimize time wastageIncrease precisionReduced overhead costs| Enhancing Personalized Shopping Experiences It is a no-brainer that personalized marketing improves a brand’s engagement with its clients, which translates into consumer loyalty, and better sales. This aspect is facilitated by the fact that AI can monitor consumption trends among consumers as well as their browsing habits because it can collect Big Data and analyze to facilitate the personalization of offers to the specific needs of each client. | Real-time Customer Support This technology is practical for enterprises that need to engage with high volumes of clients every day. For instance, airline companies that serve millions of travelers daily can use AI to send real-time alerts to the customers such as delay notices. Similarly, some businesses have already started chatbots on their websites to assist visitors to navigate the page. All this is possible because of the growing influence of AI in business. | Streamline the Hiring Process You may be surprised, but yes, AI is helping companies in the selection and recruitment of new staff. Primarily, AI can wade through several applications and rejecting those that do not meet the firm's requirements automatically. What does this mean for businesses? Essentially, using AI for recruitment is both cost-effective and time-saving because companies no longer require the services of a recruiting agency. Similarly, it eliminates cases of discrimination or bias during the shortlisting phase.  | Minimizing Time Wastage According to a report prepared by Red Letter Days for Business, workers in the UK commit over 400 million days annually on unproductive tasks. Likewise, a workspace research carried out by AtTask and Harris Interactive indicated that US workers only spend 45 percent of their time performing their core duties. What these studies imply is that business owners are paying employees for not working as much as they are expected. With AI, productivity in the workplace will be optimized. | Increase Precision Successful enterprises are built on practical decisions. Precise business intelligence facilitates good judgment. When data lacks accuracy because of mistakes, failure is always imminent. The risk of inaccurate data is enhanced for businesses that deal with large volumes of information. This is because humans are prone to errors. For corporate insights and information collection, AI will come in handy for most enterprises. | Minimize Overhead Costs Data from a US study shows that companies spent more than $70 billion on staff training and development. Apart from this obligation, they also incur costs related to staff benefits such as health insurance, paid vacations, and overtime payments that are geared towards improving motivation and productivity. Automating some of the duties with the help of AI tools means that companies can reduce their headcount, which translates into minimization of budgets set aside for employee benefits.

It helps you handle your business in a better way. But for all this, you must have a good knowledge of AI and how you use it in business. The classes are taken by faculty with years of experience and industry experts. At the end of the program, every candidate will be awarded a certificate from the University of Texas at Austin. A discussion of artificial intelligence (AI) elicits a wide range of feelings. On one end of the spectrum is fear of job loss spurred by a bot revolution. On the opposite is excitement about the overblown prospects of what people can achieve with machine augmentation. HOW BUSINESSES USE A.I. TODAY Artificial intelligence is already widely used in business applications, including automation, data analytics, and natural language processing. Across industries, these three fields of AI are streamlining operations and improving efficiencies. Automation alleviates repetitive or even dangerous tasks. Data analytics provides businesses with insights never before possible. Natural language processing allows for intelligent search engines, helpful chatbots, and better accessibility for people who are visually impaired. Other common uses for AI in business include: Transferring and cross-referencing data; updating filesConsumer behavior forecasting and product recommendationsFraud detectionPersonalized advertising and marketing messagingCustomer service via telephone or chatbots How businesses benefit from building a proof of concept (PoC) Testing the capability of the future AI projectDeep knowledge of your data that delivers concrete valueValidation of your business ideaIdentifying potential bottlenecks and drafting viable solutionsPerforming comparative analyses of multiple approachesWorking out a cost-efficient strategy of developing an AI solutionTo learn more about the influence of AI technology, review the articles: Four Ways Artificial Intelligence Can Help Your Small Business Artificial Intelligence (AI) Benefits in Business - FWS

A large number of firms are turning towards the buzz of ‘AI’ as they strive harder to put their particular needs into valuable output. According to a research study by Gartner, AI implementation in enterprises has leaped from just 10% to a whopping 37 percent – a 270% rise in 4 years. The research labs are continuously migrated by AI into the business world, where big enterprises are leveraging their power for deploying chatbots to analyzing countless data points in just a few seconds to improve customer interactions. AI Multiple has reported that the number of active AI startups in the US has increased to 113% from 2015 to 2018. Thanks to the recent advances in deep learning, AI is already powering virtual assistants, online translators, search engines, and a plethora of sales and marketing decisions. However, this article will discuss what AI has in store for global businesses in the future. The Future of AI for Global Businesses

There is an immense amount of data being generated around the world in various businesses. Business intelligence plays a pivotal role in helping analysts and marketers to understand this data. Artificial Intelligence can expedite the analysis of raw data, making it easier for analysts to study and take action based on the results. If you are a business owner trying to imagine how Artificial Intelligence can benefit your business you are not alone. Regardless of the business size, AI can help improve your current business tactics. A few ways AI can make an immediate impact is by analyzing your overall customer experience, enhancing your team’s efficiency, and cutting down on your business expenses. The vast majority of customer interactions require a human to be on the other end of the line. AI can help automate tasks across a variety of platforms, such as response with your business hours via email or chat. Artificial Intelligence has the ability to recognize the browsing habits of your customers and provide them with highly customized experiences, which increases your customer engagement. AI has the ability to mine vast amounts of data and help predict outcomes based on patterns. With the help of AI-powered tools such as Nudge, Chorus, and People you can record and transcribe sales calls. These AI-powered tools can help determine what strategies work best for your top selling reps.

With passing days, the role and impact of AI are increasing. Artificial Intelligence has spread its wings in almost every possible industry. In fact, the world soon would become dependent on Artificial Intelligence (AI). Top three Industries where Artificial Intelligence is used are: - Healthcare and Medicine - Marketing - Education Uses and Impact of AI in these industries: - Healthcare and Medicine: With the current situation around, Healthcare and Medicine quite obviously top the list. Medical professionals and organizations both are dependent on AI. Robots are used to assist doctors in major surgeries including serious ones like colorectal, heart, and thoracic. It helps in developing next-generation tools for radiology. The burden of Electronic Health Records is reduced. Helps in detecting the patient’s problems in a better way and gives solutions accordingly by monitoring the patient’s health through wearables and personal monitoring devices. Long80 is one such company that has brought around the use of AI in Healthcare Sector. - Marketing: It deals with a number of operations that can benefit if it is automated. AI helps in the automation of such operations. AI helps in taking the sales forecast to the next level. It helps in gaining a deeper understanding of the customers. Helps in optimizing the Digital Advertising campaigns. Helps in data analytics - Education: The implementation of education technology or EduTech helps in student learning and at the same time it automates tasks for the instructors. Parent-teacher conferencing is made easy with the help of AI-based appointment scheduling software. Classes happen online with the use of AI-based software. Robotic tutor assistants help students in language learning, social interactions, and reading. Apart from these three, there are many other industries that have been largely impacted by Artificial Intelligence (AI).
